com.microfocus.adm.pulse.pluginapi.chain

Interface PulseMetricBuilder


  • public interface PulseMetricBuilder

    Builder is used to create a metric definition to be registered via PulseMetricRegistrar.registerMetric(PulseMetric). Measurements can not be made against a metric until the metric has been registered with the Pulse framework. Only metrics constructed by this builder are accepted by the Pulse framework.

    No validation is performed on the properties until build() is called. If the validation fails an IllegalStateException exception will be thrown. Current validations enforced are:

    • Realm must be specified.
    • Name must be specified.
    • Value type must be specified.
    • If the metric is a PulseMetricType.SCALE the upper bound must be higher than the lower bound.

    The same builder can be used to create multiple metrics, allowing for an expert to generate all the metrics for the same type by setting the valueType on this builder and the varying the other properties. This will mean that PulseMetric returned from build() will all have the same valueType.

    Each property setter returns this builder allowing property calls to be chained together, e.g. builder.valueType(PulseMetricType.INTEGER).name("Lines of code").build()

    Registering the same metric more than once is permitted and has no adverse side effects. The second and subsequent calls will return a valid registration that can safely be used to report a measurement for the metric.

    Registering a metric for a second time allows the following metric properties to be changed:

    • Description.
    • Direction.
    Since:
    19.1.1

    • Method Detail

      • build

        PulseMetric build()

        Create a builder that can be used to build metrics to be recorded.

        Returns:
        New measurements builder. Can not be null.
        Since:
        19.1.1

      • realm

        PulseMetricBuilder realm(String realm)

        Set the realm the metric belongs to. The core realms are defined by PulseMetricCoreRealm. A definition must have a realm, but the realm can be user defined. Realms are used to group together similar types of metrics.

        Parameters:
        realm - Realm of metrics this belongs to.
        Returns:
        This metric builder. Can not be null.
        Since:
        19.1.1

      • name

        PulseMetricBuilder name(String name)

        Set the name of the metric. This will uniquely identify the metric within the experts namespace which allows metrics from different experts to have the same name. A name must be specified and can not be null or empty. The name will be displayed in the user interface.

        Parameters:
        name - Name of the metric local to the plugin it belongs to.
        Returns:
        This metric builder. Can not be null.
        Since:
        19.1.1

      • description

        PulseMetricBuilder description(String description)

        Set the description of the metric. This will be displayed in the user interface to aid the user in understanding the metric. It is an optional property.

        Parameters:
        description - Short description for this metric.
        Returns:
        This metric builder. Can not be null.
        Since:
        19.1.1

      • valueType

        PulseMetricBuilder valueType(PulseMetricType valueType)

        Set the type of value the metric measurement will be. This is not optional and can not be changed once the metric has been registered.

        Parameters:
        valueType - The type of the value for a measurement of this metric.
        Returns:
        This metric builder. Can not be null.
        Since:
        19.1.1

      • storage

        PulseMetricBuilder storage(PulseMetricStorage storage)

        Set how the measurements will be stored. By default the storage property is PulseMetricStorage.DATABASE and therefore measurements are stored in the database. If the measurement is only used to generate another measurement, then the storage should be set to PulseMetricStorage.TRANSIENT so that the measurement is discarded once the expert has completed.

        Parameters:
        storage - How to store the measurement. By default all metrics are stored in the database.
        Returns:
        This metric builder. Can not be null.
        Since:
        19.1.1

      • direction

        PulseMetricBuilder direction(PulseMetricDirection direction)

        Set the meaning of a directional change for this measurement. This is used by Pulse to make an informed decision on whether an increase in value is good or bad.

        Parameters:
        direction - Indicates if an increasing value is better or worse
        Returns:
        This metric builder. Can not be null.
        Since:
        19.1.1

      • lowerScaleBound

        PulseMetricBuilder lowerScaleBound(double lowerScaleBound)

        Set the lower bound for a PulseMetricType.SCALE type of metric.

        Parameters:
        lowerScaleBound - For a scale metric, this is the lower bound
        Returns:
        This metric builder. Can not be null.
        Since:
        19.1.1

      • upperScaleBound

        PulseMetricBuilder upperScaleBound(double upperScaleBound)

        Set the upper bound for a PulseMetricType.SCALE type of metric.

        Parameters:
        upperScaleBound - For a scale metric, this is the upper bound
        Returns:
        This metric builder. Can not be null.
        Since:
        19.1.1
